skill.name: Transparency Reporter Agent - Truth Chronicler
skill.description: **Purpose**: Creates honest, traceable records of all blockers, solutions, and system state.
skill.summary: **Purpose**: Creates honest, traceable records of all blockers, solutions, and system state.
skill.author: CleanExpo

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation with no executable code, network access, or file system operations beyond logging directories. It describes a transparency reporting system for development blockers and solutions.

content.value_statement: Development teams struggle with hidden blockers and unclear progress. This agent creates honest, detailed reports of all issues, solutions, and system health for complete transparency.
actual_capabilities: Logs development blockers with root cause analysis
Documents attempted solutions and why they failed
Generates system health reports with metrics
Tracks blocker resolution times and patterns
limitations: Requires manual input of blocker information
Needs team collaboration to maintain accuracy

use_cases.title: Track Team Blockers
use_cases.description: Maintain clear visibility into what's blocking your team and how long issues persist

use_cases.title: Stakeholder Updates
use_cases.description: Generate honest progress reports that show real status including blockers and delays

use_cases.title: System Health Monitoring
use_cases.description: Document build failures, test issues, and infrastructure problems with solutions

prompt_templates.title: Log New Blocker
prompt_templates.scenario: When you encounter a blocking issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a blocker report for: [describe the issue]. Include what failed, impact analysis, and attempted solutions.

prompt_templates.title: Document Solution
prompt_templates.prompt: Document the solution for blocker [ID]: [describe the fix]. Include what changed, verification steps, and lessons learned.

prompt_templates.title: Weekly Health Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a system health report for this week. Include active blockers, recent solutions, build health, and team velocity metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Stakeholder Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a stakeholder status update covering: completed work, current blockers, in-progress items, and next week plans.

output_examples.input: Log a blocker where the build is failing due to missing dependencies
output: - Expected behavior: npm run build completes successfully
- Actual behavior: Build fails with 'module not found' errors
- Error message: Cannot resolve 'react-hook-form' in src/components/Form.tsx
- Blocks features: User registration, form validation
- Affects team: Frontend developers, QA testing
- Business impact: Cannot deploy new user features
- Analysis: Dependency not installed in CI environment
- Related issues: Previous build #1423 had similar warnings

best_practices: Log blockers immediately when discovered - don't wait for solutions
Include specific error messages and file paths for precise tracking
Document failed attempts to help others avoid repeating them
anti_patterns: Reporting vague status like 'working on it' without details
Hiding blockers from team members or stakeholders
Not updating reports when situations change

faq.question: Is this compatible with my existing project management tools?
faq.answer: Yes, the reports are plain text that can be copied into Jira, Trello, or any tool your team uses.

faq.question: What types of blockers should I log?
faq.answer: Log any issue that stops progress: build failures, missing requirements, technical debt, or external dependencies.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my development workflow?
faq.answer: Use it during standups, retrospectives, or when escalating issues to create detailed, actionable reports.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only creates documentation - no data is transmitted or stored externally.

faq.question: What if I don't know the root cause yet?
faq.answer: Log what you know and update later. Include your investigation progress and hypotheses.

faq.question: How is this different from regular bug tracking?
faq.answer: It focuses on transparency and learning, documenting not just the issue but attempted solutions and lessons learned.
